answers.answer: I am 40 and 20 weeks pregnant. My obgyn has me on baby aspirin 81 mg. it is suppose to help thin the blood and help the baby implant better, etc.etc... It is safe to take and quite commonly used. I am still taking prenatal vitamins and extra folic acid. I am to continue taking baby aspirin until a few weeks before baby is due.Congrats on your pregnancy!

It is a blood thinner but did your doctor give you a reason for prescribing it??  I had a blood clot during my last pregnancy and I asked my ob last time about baby aspirin and he told me it will make the bleeding worse.  Baby aspirin is not for everyone, I hope your ob has a reason for this prescription.  Just be more pro-active next time and ask.

Thank you both! Cutter, thanks for making things easier for me :) and Helen, no he didn't-it was only because I told him that during my last pregnancy (in Italy with another doctor of course) my blood pressure was high or slightly high (needed to take 1 aldomet 500 mg per day)starting from the 7 month onwards ...but that's it...!

My perinatologist has me taking baby aspirin as well, simply to help prevent preeclampsia, since it is common in twin pregnancies. I am 36 years old, and 29 weeks pregnant with identical twin boys. :-)
Hey, thanks for your help! Will finally decide after the 10th-visit to the gyn....: )
Good luck Billie37. I wish you the best of luck on getting pregnant and having a healthy pregnancy.

question: Hello, I just turned 40 in October and am 5 weeks 2 days pregnant. I conceived naturally. I live in Saudi Arabia and the Doctor prescribed baby aspirin and folic acid. I then called my gyn in Italy who told me to take the "maternal Centrum DHA" which is the Italian multicentum ( has no vitamin A and does have folic acid). I asked if I could take both the centrum and the aspirin and he said it was ok. During last pregnancy ( 8 months ago) my blood pressure started increasing when I was about 7 months.It wasn't dangerously high, but enough for me to have to take Aldomet 500 mg (half in the morning and half in the evening) -everything went well at delivery. Therefore, am I safe to take the baby aspirin (called Juspirin 81 mg here) or not? I had a completely healthy child without it before, I just really want to be on the safe side and know the pro's and con's from a Doctor....thanks...
title: Is baby aspirin safe?
